revised_title: The Distribution of Nerves in Dental Pulp
tldr: The author investigates the distribution of nerves in dental pulp and their connection with the dentine. They analyze various theories and methods used by other researchers, and through their own observations, they conclude that the nerve fibers reach the dentine-pulp boundary but cannot be traced further into the dentine. The findings contribute to the understanding of the sensory impressions and sensitivity of human teeth.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Anatomy and Histology
